author: sky.cactus
content:
<https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/edit/master/EIPS/eip-2678.md>
<https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2678>
The author reasonably wanted to use tables for formatting their data, but their tables don't have header columns (not unreasonable for some of their data).  Unfortunately, GitHub markdown won't render tables at all if there is no header column, so we end up with what you see in the above two links, with an empty header.

author: sky.cactus
content: We *might* be able to add a CSS selector that will hide the headers in the Jekyll site (internet suggests you can kind of do this), but GitHub doesn't support CSS in markdown files.

author: sky.cactus
content: Thoughts on how to handle the situation?
